alert.note: Alert for Greene; Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 16 at 4:48AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central New York, including the following counties, Greene and Ulster. * WHEN...Until 800 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 447 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to heavy rain and thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ellenville, Hunter, Wallkill, Hurley, Woodstock, Windham, Prattsville, Mount Tremper, Phoenicia, Woodland Valley Campground, West Shokan, Lanesville, Kenneth L Wilson Campground, Olivebridge, West Hurley, Kerhonkson, High Falls, North-South Lake Campground, Napanoch and Wawarsing. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
